DOC.brief_summary: A single center , randomize , double blind phase I/IIa exploratory study evaluate reactogenicity , safety , immunogenicity dose-response new hepatitis B vaccine human adult
DOC.brief_title: A Study Evaluate Reactogenicity , Safety , Immunogenicity Third Generation Hepatitis B Vaccine
DOC.detailed_description: - Objectives : To explore effective dose third generation Hepatitis B vaccine evaluation reactogenicity , safety , immunogenicity . - Subjects : Adults anti-HBs antibody titer less 10 mIU/mL 3 previous injection conventional Hepatitis B vaccine . - Study hypothesis : The third generation Hepatitis B vaccine , contain preS antigens addition S antigen , ability elicit fast protection high antibody titer second generation Hepatitis B vaccine subject .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Adults 20 50 year age 2 . AntiHBs titer < 10 mIU/mL 3 . Subject able provide write informed consent oneself legal representative 1 . Hepatitis B core antibody positive patient 2 . Patient abnormal result liverfunction test 3 . Patient active microbial , viral , fungal infection need systemic treatment 4 . Patient history serious heart disease ( NYHA Functional Class III IV heart failure , myocardial infarction within 6 month , treatment require ventricular tachyarrhythmias , unstable angina etc . ) 5 . Patient seizure disorder require anticonvulsant treatment 6 . Serious chronic obstructive pulmonary disease patient accompany hypoxemia 7 . Uncontrollable diabetic patient 8 . Uncontrollable hypertension patient 9 . Patient known history HIV , HBV , HCV infection 10 . Subject experience participate clinical study clinical treatment within 30 day screen 11 . Subject hypersensitivity anaphylactic reaction HBV vaccine component 12 . Patient treat prolonged immunosuppressive therapy ( include steroid ) 13 . Hemodialysis patient 14 . Subject continuous drinking ( > 21 units/week , 1 unit = 10g pure alcohol ) dependence alcohol 15 . Subject pregnant breastfeeding intend become pregnant study 16 . Subject significant finding unacceptable study opinion investigator
